titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of His Papers, 1857-1999 and undated, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: A. Ramirez

profiledesc.creation: Text converted and initial EAD tagging provided by Abel Ramirez, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, April 20, 2004.

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Delmar Hayter Papers, 1857-1999 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: These are the papers of Texas historian Delmar Hayter.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Delmar Hayter, a veteran of World War II, was a local historian and received M. A. and Ph. D. degrees from Texas Tech University. He wrote his dissertation on the Pecos River Irrigation Company. At the time of his death, Hayter was preparing a book on Murdo Mackenzie, a prominent cattleman and long-time manager of the Matador Ranch. Hayter also contributed to The Handbook of Texas and history journals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is dominated by research materials, mostly photocopies of journal articles, book excerpts, and archival material. Subjects covered in the collection include Murdo Mackenzie and his family, the Matador Land and Cattle Company and associated persons, the ranch industry in Brazil, and general ranching history and concerns. The collection also includes research notes and manuscript drafts of a biography of Murdo Mackenzie. It is important that material originating from other archives such as the Baker Library at Harvard be properly cited.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: Correspondence, Literary Production, Murdo Mackenzie Book, Printed Material, and Research Material.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open for research but it is important that material originating from other archives, such as the Baker Library at Harvard, be properly cited.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Delmar Hayter Papers, 1857-1999 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:
